text: PREFACE
author: Einstein, Albert

text: (December, 1916)
author: Einstein, Albert

text: The present book is intended, as far as possible, to give an exact
author: Einstein, Albert

text: insight into the theory of Relativity to those readers who, from a
author: Einstein, Albert

text: general scientific and philosophical point of view, are interested in
author: Einstein, Albert

text: the theory, but who are not conversant with the mathematical apparatus
author: Einstein, Albert

text: of theoretical physics. The work presumes a standard of education
author: Einstein, Albert

text: corresponding to that of a university matriculation examination, and,
author: Einstein, Albert

text: despite the shortness of the book, a fair amount of patience and force
author: Einstein, Albert

text: of will on the part of the reader. The author has spared himself no
author: Einstein, Albert

text: pains in his endeavour to present the main ideas in the simplest and
author: Einstein, Albert

text: most intelligible form, and on the whole, in the sequence and
author: Einstein, Albert

text: connection in which they actually originated. In the interest of
author: Einstein, Albert

text: clearness, it appeared to me inevitable that I should repeat myself
author: Einstein, Albert

text: frequently, without paying the slightest attention to the elegance of
author: Einstein, Albert

text: the presentation. I adhered scrupulously to the precept of that
author: Einstein, Albert

text: brilliant theoretical physicist L. Boltzmann, according to whom
author: Einstein, Albert

text: matters of elegance ought to be left to the tailor and to the cobbler.
author: Einstein, Albert

text: I make no pretence of having withheld from the reader difficulties
author: Einstein, Albert

text: which are inherent to the subject. On the other hand, I have purposely
author: Einstein, Albert

text: treated the empirical physical foundations of the theory in a
author: Einstein, Albert

text: "step-motherly" fashion, so that readers unfamiliar with physics may
author: Einstein, Albert

text: not feel like the wanderer who was unable to see the forest for the
author: Einstein, Albert

text: trees. May the book bring some one a few happy hours of suggestive
author: Einstein, Albert

text: thought!
author: Einstein, Albert
